metadata.title: Mongolia Economic Forum - MEF 2025
metadata.description: The Mongolia Economic Forum (MEF) was established in 2010 as a non-governmental, non-profit organization to create a premier discussion platform for open, evidence-based dialogue on Mongolia's long-term development.

about.label: About Us
about.title: Mongolia's Premier Economic Platform
about.description: The Mongolia Economic Forum (MEF) was established in 2010 as a non-governmental, non-profit organization to create a premier discussion platform for open, evidence-based dialogue on Mongolia’s long-term development. Since its founding, the Forum has convened leaders from government, business, academia, and civil society to discuss key economic and social priorities and to align on practical solutions.

missionDriven.title: Mission-Driven
missionDriven.description: Creating an independent platform for open, evidence-based dialogue on Mongolia's long-term development.

multiStakeholder.title: Multi-Stakeholder
multiStakeholder.description: Convening leaders from government, business, academia, and civil society to discuss key priorities.

international.title: International Reach
international.description: Connecting Mongolian stakeholders with global institutions, investors, and development partners.

actionOriented.title: Action-Oriented
actionOriented.description: Aligning on practical solutions and policy recommendations that drive real change.

missionMn.title: Mission
missionMn.description: The Mongolia Economic Forum (MEF) was established in 2010 as a non-governmental, non-profit organization to create an independent platform for open, evidence-based dialogue on Mongolia's long-term development.

timeline.label: History
timeline.description: From our founding in 2010 to today, MEF has consistently brought together leaders to address Mongolia's most pressing economic challenges.

2010.description:
The inaugural Mongolia Economic Forum was held on 8–9 February 2010 under the auspices of Prime Minister S. Batbold with the slogan "Together we can." Discussions focused on budgetary reform, development of the mining sector, the environment and green economy, state registration reforms, capital market reforms, and competitiveness.

During this first Forum, an independent, non-governmental organization was founded under the name Mongolia Economic Forum with the mandate to organize an annual national economic forum.

2011.description:
The 2011 Forum took place on 2–4 March 2011, again under the auspices of Prime Minister S. Batbold, with the slogan "Together in Development." The program centered on four core themes: human development, development policy, governance, and infrastructure, across 15 sessions.

A key highlight was a roundtable with delegates from the World Economic Forum in the Civil Chamber of the Presidential Office, focusing on responsible mining, transparency in extractive industries, and joint efforts against corruption. The Invest Mongolia forum was also held alongside MEF, broadening investor dialogue.

2012.description:
Held on 2–6 March 2012, the Forum focused on "Economic Development: Inclusive Growth," "Social Policy: Equitable Growth," and "Competitiveness: Innovation and Green Growth." Eleven discussions explored how to ensure that economic growth translates into social progress and competitive advantage.

In preparation, a series of pre-forum debates were conducted with scientists, business leaders, and the wider public, and their feedback was reflected in the year's main themes.

2013.description:
The 2013 Forum convened on 4–5 March 2013 under the auspices of Prime Minister N. Altankhuyag, with the slogan "Mongolian Brand." Discussions explored how Mongolia can diversify beyond mining, develop a national brand, and address the challenges of being landlocked.

Plenary sessions covered national branding and development, development financing, the labor market and human resources, the legal environment, economic diversification, and the business environment, complemented by special sessions under the annual theme.

2014.description:
On 24–25 March 2014, the Forum was held under the auspices of Prime Minister N. Altankhuyag with the slogan "Made in Mongolia." With 34 breakout sessions, the agenda focused on "Scenarios for Mongolia" and "Development Policy and Planning."

Delegates from the World Economic Forum introduced scenario materials and a dedicated video, highlighting possible development pathways for Mongolia and encouraging long-term strategic thinking.

2015.description:
The 2015 Forum took place on 2–3 April 2015 with the support of Prime Minister Ch. Saikhanbileg under the slogan "Trust." Over two days, 18 subject discussions were held on Mongolia's long-term vision and the macroeconomic situation.

A central theme was how to improve Mongolia's credit rating and credibility in international financial markets, emphasizing fiscal discipline, policy stability, and investor confidence.

2016.description:
Held on 30–31 March 2016 with the support of Prime Minister Ch. Saikhanbileg, the Forum adopted the slogan "Lessons, Challenges, and Solutions." The first day focused on global and regional economic trends and Mongolia's economic trajectory, while the second day centered on the business environment.

An important segment addressed Mongolia's long-term development policy, bringing together representatives of the five parliamentary parties. The event also marked the 25th anniversary of Mongolia's membership in the Asian Development Bank, with participation from ADB's Southeast Asia Director.

2018.description:
The "Mongolia Economic Forum 2018" was held on 21–22 May 2018 under the theme "Let's Synergize." The Forum opened with the plenary session "Integrated Investment Policy and Implementation Programs of Mongolia," followed by discussions focused on attracting development financing and promoting investment into Mongolia.

During the Forum, the Government introduced its "Three Pillared Development Strategy" to the public.

2022.description:
After a pause, the Forum returned on 7–8 April 2022 under the theme "New Recovery." Supported by the Mongolia Economic Forum NGO, the event focused on Mongolia's New Revival Policy and how to address post-crisis economic and social challenges.

Twelve side sessions examined revival in key sectors, seeking a shared understanding and practical policy directions. Participants included representatives from government, business, universities, research institutions, and international organizations.

2023.description:
The 2023 Forum was held on 9–10 July 2023 with the theme "Welcome to Mongolia." Around 1,500 participants gathered across five locations. Plenary sessions discussed the sustainable development policy of Mongolia, the economy and sustainability, "New Future – New Opportunities," and infrastructure.

Prime Minister Luvsannamsrain Oyun-Erdene inaugurated the Forum, while Chairman of the State Great Khural G. Zandanshatar delivered the main address. Senior executives from the Asian Development Bank and Rio Tinto Group joined as honored guests.

2024.description:
On 8–9 July 2024, the Forum convened under the theme "Go Mongolia." The event brought together around 2,000 participants, featuring four plenary sessions and 12 side sessions over two days. Plenaries focused on "What's next – Development policy," "Green energy and energy transition," "Smart city," and "FDI in the banking sector."

Side sessions explored tourism, mining, intensive agriculture, the energy transition, and other priority sectors. Prime Minister Luvsannamsrain Oyun-Erdene inaugurated the Forum, and Chairman of the State Great Khural Amarbayasgalan Dashzeveg delivered the main speech.

2025.description:
The 2025 Mongolia Economic Forum took place on 8–9 July 2025 under the theme "Together for Tomorrow." The Forum continued MEF's mission of convening high-level dialogue on Mongolia's future development path, focusing on collaboration across government, business, and civil society to address emerging challenges and opportunities.

The event was inaugurated by Prime Minister Gombojavyn Zandanshatar.

whyParticipate.label: Why Participate
whyParticipate.title: Why Join MEF?
whyParticipate.description: Discover the unique opportunities the Mongolia Economic Forum offers to participants.

1.title: Engage with Decision-Makers
1.description: The MEF provides a unique platform where business leaders, academics, civil society, and citizens can interact directly with the Prime Minister, government leaders, Parliament representatives, and policy makers.

2.title: Solution-Driven Dialogues
2.description: The Forum's agenda focuses on strategic priorities such as economic policy, investment climate, financial markets, green transition, digitalization, and infrastructure—creating a space for honest and outcome-oriented dialogue.

3.title: International Connections
3.description: With regular participation from the Asian Development Bank, World Economic Forum, global companies, and foreign investors, MEF offers exceptional opportunities to build regional and international partnerships.

4.title: Latest Insights & Trends
4.description: Plenary and side sessions deliver updated data, analysis, and perspectives on Mongolia's development policy, sustainable growth, green energy, mining, agriculture, innovation, and more.

5.title: Policy Impact
5.description: MEF does more than discuss—its outcomes are consolidated into practical recommendations and shared with government and stakeholders, ensuring participants influence real policy processes.

6.title: Expand Your Network
6.description: With over 2,000 participants, the Forum brings together leaders from diverse sectors, offering high-value networking and collaboration opportunities.

7.title: Shape Mongolia's Future
7.description: Your participation contributes directly to national dialogue on Mongolia's long-term development—with every voice playing a role in shaping a shared future.

faq.label: FAQ
faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Find answers to common questions about the Mongolia Economic Forum.

what.question: What is the Mongolia Economic Forum (MEF)?
what.answer: The Mongolia Economic Forum (MEF) is a national premier discussion platform where the government, private sector, academia, civil society, and international organizations openly discuss Mongolia’s economic and development policies.

who.question: Who can participate?
who.answer: Participation is open to government institutions, private sector leaders, entrepreneurs, researchers, university faculty and students, international organizations, investors, and anyone interested in Mongolia’s development issues.

importance.question: What are the benefits of participating?
answer: Take part in solution-driven public–private dialogues
Connect with international institutions and investors
Access the latest insights and trends in key sectors

topics.question: What are the main topics discussed at the Forum?
topics.answerIntro: The topics vary each year depending on national policy priorities. Examples include:
answer: Financial markets and credit ratings, etc.

where.question: Where is the Forum held?
where.answer: The MEF is organized across multiple locations each year depending on the program and participant needs. Plenary and sub-sessions have traditionally been held at locations such as the Government Palace, central conference halls, the Chinggis Khaan Museum, Shangri-La Hotel Ulaanbaatar, and Galleria Ulaanbaatar.

register.question: How can I register?
register.answer: Official registration is conducted through the MEF website and public announcements. As seating is limited, advance registration is required.

fee.question: Is there a registration fee?
fee.answer: Yes. The participation fee is MNT 1,000,000 for domestic participants and USD 500 for international participants. Fees may vary depending on that year’s organizational arrangements.

foreigners.question: How can international participants join?
foreigners.answer: International attendees may register through the online registration form or participate through invitations, diplomatic channels, institutional representation, or international partnerships.

language.question: In what language is the Forum conducted?
language.answer: The main sessions are conducted with interpretation in Mongolian and English.

contribute.question: Can participants provide comments or feedback during the Forum?
contribute.answer: Yes. Participant insights and questions shared during sub-sessions and Q&A segments contribute to the formulation of policy recommendations.

sponsor.question: How can an organization become a sponsor or partner?
sponsor.answer: Organizations interested in sponsorship or strategic partnerships may contact the MEF team directly to discuss collaboration packages and opportunities.

nextYear.question: How can I receive information about next year’s Forum?
nextYear.answer: Updates are regularly posted on the MEF’s official website, social media channels, and news platforms.

results.question: Where are the Forum’s outcomes published?
results.answer: Summary reports, recommendations, policy briefs, photos, and video archives are published through the Forum’s official channels after the event.

government.question: Is the MEF a government event?
government.answer: No. The MEF is an independent, non-governmental, non-profit organization. Its purpose is to strengthen collaboration between the government and the private sector, and the participation of the Prime Minister and key policymakers has become a tradition due to the Forum’s significance.

mongolia.label: Discover Mongolia
mongolia.title: About Mongolia
mongolia.description: Learn about the land of the eternal blue sky.
mongolia.geographyTitle: Land of the Eternal Blue Sky
mongolia.geographyP1: Mongolia is a landlocked country in East Asia, bordered by Russia to the north and China to the south. With an area of 1,564,116 square kilometers, it is the world's 18th-largest country and the most sparsely populated sovereign nation.
mongolia.geographyP2: Known for its vast steppes, the Gobi Desert, and nomadic culture, Mongolia offers a unique blend of ancient traditions and modern development. The country experiences over 260 sunny days per year, earning its nickname 'The Land of the Eternal Blue Sky.'
mongolia.economyDescription: Mongolia's economy is driven by mining, agriculture, and an emerging services sector, with strong growth potential.
mongolia.ctaDescription: Experience the beauty, culture, and opportunities of Mongolia firsthand.

agenda.label: Forum Agenda
agenda.title: MEF 2025 Agenda
agenda.description: Explore the comprehensive program featuring plenary sessions, sub-sessions, and networking opportunities across two days of impactful discussions.
agenda.infoDescription: Each session offers unique opportunities to engage with experts, policymakers, and industry leaders shaping Mongolia's future.

contact.label: Contact Us

contact.description: Have questions? We'd love to hear from you.

footer.description: The premier platform for dialogue on Mongolia's economic development, bringing together leaders from government, business, and civil society since 2010.
